questions.explanation: Bitcoin is scarce digital property secured by cryptography.
Protocol rules cap supply at 21 million.
Private keys sign transactions proving control.
Bitcoin removes reliance on trusted third parties for digital value transfer.

questions.q: Bitcoin vs fiat: the key difference is:
questions.explanation: Bitcoin issuance is algorithmic and capped; fiat is discretionary.
Bitcoin can be moved globally and verified digitally.
Thousands of nodes collectively enforce the ledger rules.
Consensus plus PoW enforce the 21M cap and valid transactions.
The network is online worldwide at all times.

questions.q: Owning bitcoin without holding keys means:
questions.explanation: If another party holds keys, they can restrict your access.
Rules enforce a fixed schedule immune to politics.

questions.q: Which term describes Bitcoin's lack of central control?
questions.explanation: Bitcoin is decentralized across many participants.

questions.q: A key benefit of sats pricing is:
Transparency of supply is provided by:
questions.explanation: Anyone can verify issuance rules and chain data.
